ext_descriptions.ext_description: the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this .

A Circular_runout_tolerance is a type of that constrains the deviation of features constructed about an axis or at right angles to an axis. Each measurement position, either along the axis, or away from the axis, is independently rotated through 360 degrees.

the direction in which the runout tolerance is controlled. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the angle is specified, the runout tolerance applies in this angle which is fixed with respect to the datum axis. If the angle is not specified, the runout tolerance applies normal to the surface generated by the rotation.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

ext_description.p: A Coaxiality_tolerance is a type of that constrains a centre point or plane of a surface of revolution, or of circular elements, about a datum feature.
ext_description.note: Some tolerancing standards require the use of position tolerance for control of coaxiality.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

ext_description.p: A Common_datum is a type of that specifies a set of two or more instances of of equal importance which are used to establish a single datum plane or axis.
ext_description.note: A common datum is in some tolerancing standards called a multiple datum feature.
A Common_datum may refer to two that have different values for the tolerance condition.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the set of
objects that form the Common_datum.

A Concentricity_tolerance is a type of
that controls the median points of a surface of revolution relative to a datum axis.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
A Cylindricity_tolerance is a type of . It constrains the form of a cylindrical feature.

ext_description.p: A Datum is a theoretically exact point, straight line, or plane used as a reference for locating and orienting tolerance zones.
ext_description.note: The concept of datum for tolerancing is defined in ISO 5459.
ext_description.p:
A Datum is either a
or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Datum_defined_by_derived_shape is a type of
and a type of .

A Datum_defined_by_feature is a type of
that is defined by datum feature.
the that is the datum feature used to define the datum.

ext_description.p:
A Datum_defined_by_targets is a type of that is defined by a set of
objects.
ext_description.note: Datums are established from a set of datum targets when the use of an entire feature would introduce excessive variations or lack of repeatability in measurements.

ext_description.p: the type of datum that is defined by the Datum_defined_by_targets.
ext_description.example:
The rule_description 'V-block' indicates that two
objects on a cylindrical element are supposed to form the areas of contact in a V-shaped fixture.
ext_description.p: The rule_description need not be specified for a particular Datum_defined_by_targets.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the set of
objects that define the Datum_defined_by_targets.
A Datum_reference is the usage of a by a geometric tolerance.
the priority assigned to this instance of when it is referenced by a geometric tolerance.
the instance of that is referenced by the Datum_reference

a
that is associated with the application of the Datum_reference. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Datum_target is the identification of a portion of a feature, that is used in the construction of a
when it is not desired to use an entire feature nor a substantial region. A Datum_target is a component of a .
ext_description.example:
A cylindrical part is stabilized for measurement by resting it in a V block, thereby establishing a
from two instances of , which are straight lines.
ext_description.p:
A Datum_target is either a
or a , or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identifier of the Datum_target.
A Flatness_tolerance is a type of that constraints the form of a planar feature.

A Geometric_tolerance is a specification of the allowed deviation of some element of the shape of a product from its theoretically exact shape. A Geometric_tolerance is either an
or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a

the
to which the Geometric_tolerance is associated.
the that is associated with the application or the Geometric_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the word or group of words by which the Geometric_tolerance is referred to. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: a text that provides additional information about the Geometric_tolerance.
ext_description.example: 'not concave', 'boundary' are examples of qualifying note.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a length of a segment that constrains how the tolerance applies. All along any segment of this size, taken on the toleranced element, the toleranced element shall conform to the tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number of decimal digits indicating the accuracy of the tolerance value. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the value of the width of the tolerance zone. The meaning of this value will depend on the standard used for the interpretation of the geometric tolerance.

ext_description.p: the classification information on how the Geometric_tolerance shall be interpreted without giving details. The value of this attribute need not be specified. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'calculated': The value has been calculated from a digital representation;
'designed': The value represents a value intended by the design;
'measured': The value has been measured on a manufactured part;

ext_description.note: A Geometric_tolerance may be specified in the design stage of a product but it may also be documented as measured on a prototype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If specified, the segment_size shall be a value of a length measure.
If specified, the tolerance_value shall be a value of a length measure.
If specified, the significant_digits number shall be greater than 0.

A Geometric_tolerance_relationship is a relationship between two instances of .
The meaning of the relationship is specified within the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li:
precedence: The relating
is of higher priority than the related;

simultaneity: The relating and the related
shall be met simultaneously, that is, in the same actual datum reference frame.

ext_description.p: Other kinds of relationships may be specified if appropriate to a particular tolerancing system.
ext_description.example: The position tolerance of a each feature of a pattern of features may be specified with a , and the relationships between the features in the pattern may be specified by another.

A different position tolerance may be specified for each end of a long hole. A Geometric_tolerance_relationship could be used to express that an interpolated value applies at intermediate points, thus creating a conical tolerance zone

ext_description.p: one of the instances of that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Line_profile_tolerance is a type of that specifies the definition of a uniform boundary along the true profile within which the elements of the toleranced surface shall lie. The tolerance zone established by a Line_profile_tolerance is two dimensional.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

A Placed_target is a type of
that specifies a
that is represented implicitly by parameters. A Placed_target is either a
or a , or a , or a , or a .

the
in which the
that serves as parameter_reference is defined.

the
to which the parameters or the Placed_target refer.

ext_description.p:
A Position_tolerance is a type of that controls the position of a
that is a feature of size. It can be interpreted either as defining a positional boundary within which the entire feature is permitted to lie, or as defining a tolerance zone within which the centre, axis, or centre plane of the considered
is permitted to lie.
ext_description.note: Basic theoretically exact dimensions establish the true position from specified datum features and between interrelated features.
The concept of position tolerances is defined in ISO 5458.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
ext_description.note: When a Position_tolerance is the feature relating Position_tolerance of a composite tolerance, it need not have a datum reference frame.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Projection is a type of . It specifies a condition where a
is projected from an element of a part. The projection is external to the part and made from one of the ends of the element for a specified length.

the
from which the tolerance zone is projected.
the distance from the projection_end to where the shall be measured.

ext_description.p: A Reference_plane is the specification of a plane that is used to further specify the application of objects.
ext_description.note: The Reference_plane may be used to specify a projection plane or a family of cutting planes in order to locate a tolerance zone.
ext_description.example: A straightness tolerance may apply to each linear element in a surface. The reference plane establishes the direction of the elements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Roundness_tolerance is a type of
that specifies a tolerance zone bounded by two concentric circles within which each circular element of a surface must lie. For a sphere, a circular element is all points of the surface intersected by any plane passing through a common center. For other surfaces, a circular element is all points of the surface intersected by any plane perpendicular to an axis. The Roundness_tolerance condition applies independently at any plane.

ext_description.p:
A Single_datum is a type of
that specifies a point, line, axis, or plane used as a reference for locating and orienting tolerance zones.
ext_description.note: A single datum is usually derived from a single datum feature.
ext_description.p:
A Single_datum is either a
or a
or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the word or group of words by which the Single_datum is referred to.

the , the , or the
that represents the Single_datum.
A Straightness_tolerance is a type of that specifies a tolerance zone within which the considered element of a feature or a derived median line must lie.
the plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Surface_profile_tolerance is a type of that is the definition of a uniform boundary along an ideal profile within which the elements of a surface must lie.
The tolerance zone established by a Surface_profile_tolerance is three dimensional, extending along the length and the width of the considered feature as a whole respectively along each segment of a defined size if the
attribute is specified. If the tolerance is to be unequally disposed about the theoretically exact feature, a
having only one boundary element is associated to the instance of Surface_profile_tolerance.

ext_description.p: the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
ext_description.note: When a Surface_profile_tolerance is a refinement of a related Surface_profile_tolerance, it need not have a datum reference frame.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Symmetry_tolerance is a type of that is a constraint on the amount of deviation a toleranced element may have from being symmetrical to a datum. Any edge or (median) plane of the part must lie in a tolerance zone limited by two parallel lines or planes, symmetrically located with respect to a datum.
the plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.

A Target_area is a type of
that specifies an area bounded by a closed . The shape of the Target_area is described explicitly by a set of curves with reference to the part coordinate system.

A Target_circle is a type of that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit circle. The
may be the area inside the circle or the circle, depending on the geometry. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the Target_circle is the x-y-plane of the .
the diameter of the datum target.

A Target_circular_curve is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit circular curve. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the
is the x-y-plane of the .
the diameter of the datum target.

A Target_curve is a type of
that is specified by a single curve.

A Target_point is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by a single implicit point. The position of the Target_point is defined by the placing .

A Target_rectangle is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit rectangle.
The centre of the rectangle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the Target_rectangle is the x-y-plane with half the length of the rectangle in positive and half the length in negative direction along the x-axis and with half the width of the rectangle in positive and half the width in negative direction along the y-axis of the .
the length of the Target_rectangle.
the width of the Target_rectangle

A Target_straight_line is a type of that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit straight line.
The first end point of the Target_straight_line is specified by the placing . The second end point is located on the z-axis of the
at the specified distance.
the length of the Target_straight_line.

ext_description.p: A Tolerance_condition is a specification of the material condition of a feature of size, which is its actual size with respect to its size tolerance.
ext_description.note: The set of candidate tolerance zones for tolerances with datum reference depends on the material condition of any referenced datum features of size.
The set of candidate tolerance zones of a depends on the material condition of the toleranced feature of size.

ext_description.p: the kind of Tolerance_condition.
ext_description.example: Maximum material condition (MMC) is an example of a condition.
Least material condition (LMC) is an example of a condition.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone is the specification of the zone wherein all points of the toleranced element shall fall.

ext_description.p: the shape of the Tolerance_zone.
ext_description.example:
A
has a tolerance zone that is based on the profile of the feature. The form_type is 'profile'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the set of
objects for which the Tolerance_zone defines the zone.

A Tolerance_zone_definition is the specification of the set of s for which the
defines the zone.
the that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition.

ext_description.p:
the that represents the first bounding element.
that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition.
ext_description.example:
A may be unequally disposed so as to lie entirely on the inbound (material) side of the theoretically exact feature. The first_element of the tolerance zone is the outer boundary and is modeled as an
with of zero.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that represents the second bounding element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Total_runout_tolerance is a type of that constrains the deviation features constructed about an axis or at right angles to an axis. It constrains the deviation over a surface with respect to a datum axis the part is rotated about. The tolerance is applied simultaneously to all measuring positions as the part is rotated 360 degrees.
the direction with respect to the datum axis in which a runout tolerance is controlled.

ext_description.p: the set of datum references that defines the datum reference frame for this geometric tolerance.
ext_description.note: The datum axis may be a secondary datum.
